snippet: This case — in which a lawsuit claims that part of the classic hit was copied from “Taurus,” a tune by Spirit — is being watched as a test of the limits of copyright.
abstract: Music industry is closely watching copyright infringement case against rock band Led Zeppelin, slated to begin soon in Los Angeles; $40 million lawsuit alleges parts of group’s signature hit Stairway to Heaven were copied from Taurus, instrumental tune from band Spirit; case will test copyright limits and could ultimately impact creativity.
lead_paragraph: This case — in which a lawsuit claims that part of the classic hit was copied from “Taurus,” a tune by Spirit — is being watched as a test of the limits of copyright.

headline.main: Led Zeppelin’s ‘Stairway to Heaven’ to Be Scrutinized in Court in Copyright Case
headline.print_headline: Led Zeppelin Members Set to Defend ‘Stairway’
